intro: Alsophila hyacinthei var. humblotii, commonly known as the Humblot's tree fern, is a species native to Madagascar. It is a member of the Cyatheaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant exhibits a distinctive spiral arrangement of its fronds, which gives it a graceful, ornamental appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
